title: Drug Behaviour Imaging on Phenix

source.description: First identify the drugs to be used in the study and ensure that they are correctly labelled and handled.
Calculate the desired weight and volume of solvent required for the desired concentration if using powdered compounds. Alternatively calculate the desired dilution for liquid compounds.

source.body: Important point – Ensure that your calculations are 1000 fold higher at this stage as your compound will be diluted when it is added to the plate. E.g. mM for uM active concentration

source.description: Inside a fume hood with an analytical balance weigh out the desired amount of compound into an Eppendorf tube labelled with the compound and the final concentration.
While still in the fume hood add the desired amount of solvent (eg DMSO) to get the right compound concentration, and close the lid of the Eppendorf tube
Finally, to ensure the compound is dissolved fully, vortex the Eppendorf tubes (ensuring the lid is firmly in place) at setting 10 for 30 seconds.

source.body: NOTE: Some compounds require longer vortexing times (especially at higher concentrations) to ensure they completely dissolve. In these instances, repeat until fully dissolved.

source.description: Select the appropriate number of fresh unseeded 35mm NGM plates (no older than 3 days) and inspect to ensure an even level of agar.

source.body: NOTES: If plates are uneven the images can appear blurry as the different height can result in out of focus patched. Different level of agar indicates that there is a different volume and so the resultant concentration of drug will be affected

source.description:
Label the side of each plate with the compound name, compound concentration and the date.
See the attached spreadsheet as a template for planning the imaging throughout the day
Inside a flow hood apply 50ul of sterile water to the centre of the agar (this is to help the drug spread over the agar surface where the OP50 will be applied)
Before this dries apply 3.5ul of your compound solution (ensuring the correct compound and concentration is used).
Allow to dry in the flow hood with the lids off (this should take around 30 minutes).
Once dry seed the plates with 50ul OP50 into the centre of each drug plate from the fridge

source.body:
NOTES:
Take a falcon tube of OP50 from the fridge and vortex on setting 10 until all the pellet has dissolved and not visible clumps remain in the solution.
Dilute the OP50 1:10 in M9 solution
Normally when doing this stage, you might have many plates to do, in these instances the ones that were drugged first will probably dry before you have finished. Therefore, check for plates that have dried and replace the lids to ensure that there is no overdrying.

source.description: Leave the plates overnight at room temperature in the dark.
First identify and label plates in accordance with the experimental Excel template.
For each set pick 10 worms from your synchronised plates onto each of the drug plates. This should be completed within 10 minutes for each set to ensure equivalence.

After 3h 30m has elapsed transfer 10 worms to the drugged imaging plates
Leave to accimate o the new plate for 30 mins
Image for 15 minutes at 25fps with the .hdf5 file format.
Transfer the files to the server.

source.title: Bleach synchronisation of C. elegans

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"4f0fh","text":"Wash hermaphrodites off plate with several ml of M9 solution and transfer to 15ml falcon tube (Fisher Scientific-Falcon 352096)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"EAA5CAA6066D48108EC61B919DA84309","id":734377,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Washing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6gje6","text":"Fill falcon tube up to 15ml with M9 solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"8CE6FC44EDB142AE88F3807D0ED9CEBF","id":734378,"previous_id":734377,"previous_guid":"EAA5CAA6066D48108EC61B919DA84309","section":"Washing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eodli","text":"Centrifuge for 2 minutes at 1500 rpm (RCF:210, ascending 9; descending 7) \u2013 program 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"408q1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"edr02","text":"Program 1 retains the worms as pellets and the bacteria is suspended as the supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"beln7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ua7c","text":"The descending is slow as the worm pellet is lose at this stage which we don't want to break","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"5CBEC650BD2A4B86BEDC756EDAFAF1F1","id":734379,"previous_id":734378,"previous_guid":"8CE6FC44EDB142AE88F3807D0ED9CEBF","section":"Washing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brvgo","text":"Remove supernatant using a plastic Pasteur pipette taking care not to disturb pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8f130","text":"Leave atleast 0.5ml M9 to avoid disturbing the pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"80F3EC7BCB1841249896E6536BF06D3F","id":734380,"previous_id":734379,"previous_guid":"5CBEC650BD2A4B86BEDC756EDAFAF1F1","section":"Washing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36rit","text":"Fill the tube with M9 upto 15ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3DE5FA27564642D58BECA4A486588056","id":734381,"previous_id":734380,"previous_guid":"80F3EC7BCB1841249896E6536BF06D3F","section":"Washing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4h9b5","text":"Spin program 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F6889D9026094658B0F962BD18AED5E3","id":734382,"previous_id":734381,"previous_guid":"3DE5FA27564642D58BECA4A486588056","section":"Washing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3k1sq","text":"Repeat steps 4-6 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":17,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"1630C0AEB73542259E08D758B4300149","id":734383,"previous_id":734382,"previous_guid":"F6889D9026094658B0F962BD18AED5E3","section":"Washing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8jndd","text":"On final wash remove as much supernatant as possible and add M9 upto 4ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"D70AE5202894467A8F6B95AB7DD8488C","id":734384,"previous_id":734383,"previous_guid":"1630C0AEB73542259E08D758B4300149","section":"Washing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62r2v","text":"Vortex on maximum setting for 4 min (no more as this will damage the eggs) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6qu9k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8a6od","text":"Makesure the vortex forms ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"61r7h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"etoc6","text":"After vortexing, top up the tube with M9 till 15ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"CA219FAAAD3C4B429F5D3712844091DB","id":734386,"previous_id":734385,"previous_guid":"BE7C986A6F0941A19609D065395DA7E9","section":"Bleaching"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cahme","text":"Centrifuge for 2 mins at 2500rpm (RCF:590, ascending 9; descending 7) \u2013 program 2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cj03q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"70c74","text":"(Always check the program on the centrifuge before using it)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"50161A125DF640F7AD47BBAFD5BFEEDA","id":734387,"previous_id":734386,"previous_guid":"CA219FAAAD3C4B429F5D3712844091DB","section":"Bleaching"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7khv7","text":"Remove supernatant by pouring into waste bottle \u2013 pellet should be compact and yellow in colour at bottom of falcon, but be careful not to lose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bm3b6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f2u92","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"64FD4D8BC14E402A9BE1B0E47D79CFE5","id":734388,"previous_id":734387,"previous_guid":"50161A125DF640F7AD47BBAFD5BFEEDA","section":"Bleaching"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"65rd8","text":"Add 15ml M9","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B62A0F4C1FA8404496FDD51E9EDABBB8","id":734389,"previous_id":734388,"previous_guid":"64FD4D8BC14E402A9BE1B0E47D79CFE5","section":"Bleaching"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"48ltj","text":"Centrifuge at program 2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"DC5F2EF03D3F4BDAB2630C8CC859F6DB","id":734390,"previous_id":734389,"previous_guid":"B62A0F4C1FA8404496FDD51E9EDABBB8","section":"Bleaching"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e2rd9","text":"Repeat steps 12-14 four more times","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e54tp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"46ji2","text":"The number of washes is crucial here as we need to get rid of all the bleach","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9mqmn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B8C409813F5541358F1C184CC85F4172","id":734391,"previous_id":734390,"previous_guid":"DC5F2EF03D3F4BDAB2630C8CC859F6DB","section":"Bleaching"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7p1in","text":"Centrifuge larvae on program 2 to pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"6D12441815114B0FBFA9F1A98AD5CE56","id":734393,"previous_id":734392,"previous_guid":"63A2346ACAF9415D84BD86B1C37A1283","section":"Feeding"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"gjoo","text":"Remove supernatant with plastic Pasteur pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1h9rc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1qu2","text":"The pellet is lose here so makesure not to disturb it","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"D45543BEE715476E8FAEC77866865E09","id":734394,"previous_id":734393,"previous_guid":"6D12441815114B0FBFA9F1A98AD5CE56","section":"Feeding"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nji7","text":"Add 15ml M9, spin to wash","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"5D7CAAB391AC4655BCAC462527990946","id":734395,"previous_id":734394,"previous_guid":"D45543BEE715476E8FAEC77866865E09","section":"Feeding"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75gje","text":"On final wash leave 0.5ml M9 in falcon","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"D092CD1BC4054ABC9C92FEE7A3E07F75","id":734397,"previous_id":734395,"previous_guid":"5D7CAAB391AC4655BCAC462527990946","section":"Feeding"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2qb4g","text":"Resuspend the pellet by gently tapping the tube\/flicking it","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"C8E53A23D5F74A689ABF43364109F239","id":734398,"previous_id":734397,"previous_guid":"D092CD1BC4054ABC9C92FEE7A3E07F75","section":"Feeding"}

source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"aisuj","text":"This protocol is for obtaining synchronised populations of C. elegans. Eggs are harvested from gravid hermaphrodites and allow to grow to L1 arrest for 12-120 hours (0.5-5days). L1 larvae are then fed and left to develop to the appropriate developmental stage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":59,"length":10,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

source.title: Making low peptone NGM for imaging plates
source.title_html: Making low peptone NGM for imaging plates

versions.title_html: Making low peptone NGM for imaging plates

versions.title: Making low peptone NGM for imaging plates
versions.title_html: Making low peptone NGM for imaging plates

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"309bv","text":" Book the autoclave (notebook on top of the machine).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8jj73","text":" Take clean flasks from the glass kitchen.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1djq8","text":" Measure all the pre-autoclave reagents and add to the flask (Use a new weighing boat and spatula for each reagent. Also, the cholesterol is kept in the fridge.)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"du0k","text":" Once water is added mix thoroughly and label with autoclave tape (\u2018Low peptone NGM Rm 5020\u2019). Makesure the bottle is not screwed completely when placing it inside the autoclave machine.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d1upm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"1FA52ED478BE4411ADFEA2C6C00943E5","id":739664,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Pre-Autoclave:"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"do41r","text":" When autoclave is complete, remove the probe flask ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9f79r","text":" Make sure to wear gloves as the flask will be hot","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fe27u","text":" Let the agar to cool to around 55\u00b0C, ie the bottle is cool enough to hold for a second with a gloved hand.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"rb6n","text":" Add the post autoclave reagents.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3iou4","text":" Mix it well and start pouring onto imaging plates   (See Protocol for plate pouring)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6qt0f","text":"Try not to shake the bottle too much while mixing to avoid air bubbles.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7v7q2","text":"The agar needs to be warm to be poured without blocking the tubings, so try to pour as quickly as possible and if not poured immediately put the bottle on a waterbath set to 60C until being used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"CFEE2975283045AF8BBE5F9DEE494B1F","id":739665,"previous_id":739666,"previous_guid":"A2ECAAFB8E8D4AED97B6595332B05BAC","section":"Post autoclave:"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3n4ll","text":"     - Turn ON the autoclave","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5hcii","text":"     - Make sure that the autoclave\u2019s probe bottle is the same size as the largest bottle you use and fill it with water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6m9aj","text":"     - Place the temperature probe in it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"64o03","text":"     - Fill up the autoclave with water until it reaches the grill.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e2tak","text":"     - Place the bottles in the autoclave and make sure that the cap is not screwed completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"15kuc","text":"     - Check the waste flask is not too full","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f30mb","text":"     - Use \u2018media\u2019 program. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3da1n","text":"     - Press START.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9b3ll","text":"     - It will take about 2 hours for a 500ml bottle to autoclave and about 2.5 hours for 1L or larger bottles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3or95","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"A2ECAAFB8E8D4AED97B6595332B05BAC","id":739666,"previous_id":739664,"previous_guid":"1FA52ED478BE4411ADFEA2C6C00943E5","section":"Using the autoclave:"}

source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"37sqq","text":"C. elegans is maintained in the laboratory on Nematode Growth Medium (NGM) agar which has been aseptically poured into petri plates. The NGM agar medium can be poured into petri plates easily and aseptically using a peristaltic pump. This pump can be adjusted so that a constant amount of NGM agar is dispensed into each petri plate. A constant amount of agar in the plates reduces the need for refocusing the microscope when you switch from one plate to another.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7a41p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"70s5t","text":"For imaging purposes, low peptone NGM is prepared which contains less concentration of bactopeptone as compared to the normal NGM. This is because we don't want the seeded bacteria to grow too much and obscure the images, rather just sufficient enough to keep the worms from crawling out of the plate due to lack of food. The imaging plates can be 35mm, 60mm or 90mm in diameter depending on the assay design.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fo0e9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"27lv3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"644a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
Refeed L1s to get young adults on the day of tracking

description: For imaging drug-treated young adult C. elegans in liquids using the Multiworm tracker. Worms are synchronised by picking L4s, and then the young adults are exposed to drugs for 4 hours prior to imaging for 15 mins in a liquid droplet on a coverslip mounted on a 3.5cm plate.
